ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I had a challenging semester due to our hockey season being cancelled, which forced me to play hockey elsewhere. This did not allow me to dedicate as much time as i needed to this course, so i did not retain many of the topics taught.
The fundamental skills of calculus which will help when taking economics.l
I learned how to problem solve and do differentiation and integrals.
I gained a conceptual understanding of Calculus and strengthened my critical thinking/quantitative reasoning skills.
i learned calculus
By taking this course, I improved my skills in differentiation and integration. In addition, the unit circle review was incredibly helpful to fill the gaps in my knowledge.
In this course I learned skills relating to limits, differentiation, and integrals. I learned what they are, how to calculate them, and how to use those skills in real world applications.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I thought it was ran well and many resources were available for help.
I think this course is perfect

I thought this course was fantastic. It was well organized and the pace was great. The exams were difficult but fair. The problem sets were very difficult at times but if you attend office hours it's easy to get extra help.
Professor Hall was amazing and Ryan the TA helped so much

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Workshops and office hours were great, but it was challenging to stay engaged with math over zoom.
The notes succeeded, and so did the workshops. Those were a great way to dive deeper into the material.
I really liked the discussion sections and routineness of weekly problem sets. I think the changing of due dates for problem sets sometimes was confusing, though.
everything worked great

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Yes I wouldo
Yes, Dr. Hall is an awesome teacher.
I would recommend this course if you have no calculus experience. I feel as though I am behind the curve, and I wished I would have pushed to place into MATH 112
Yes I would. Looking back, it was a great decision to enroll into Math 110/111.
yes it was ceey interesting
I would highly recommend this course to a student needing to ease back into math and calculus at Yale. Math 111 was an excellent course which will prepare me for Math 115.

Yes! Dr. Hall was a great teacher and this class was well organized and well structured for learning. This class is great for people coming into Yale not super confident in their math skill. Math concepts an taught and explained in a way that is easy to understand, and this class made sure students really understood the basis of what was being taught and used that to build up to bigger ideas and applications of skills. This class really builds a strong mathematical foundation for its students.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Workshops and office hours.
weekly discussion section
none
There was also a live, virtual workshop every week.
This course was a live virtual lecture with small group work to practice skills incorporated into class time.
